str:ConceptScheme.com:Name: Master Data Concepts
str:ConceptScheme.com:Description: Standardized concepts and definitions for describing data elements across datasets, covering cross-cutting data attributes such as temporal information, country, unit of measure, transformation.

str:Concept.com:Name: Comments
str:Concept.com:Description: Additional notes, explanations, or remarks regarding the data, methodology, or other aspects of an observation.

str:Concept.com:Name: Observation Status
str:Concept.com:Description: Indicates the status of an observation within a dataset, such as whether it is a provisional value, an estimated value, a final figure, or a value where a time series break occurs. (Source: SDMX)

str:Concept.com:Name: Derivation Type
str:Concept.com:Description: Identifies the specific method used to derive a new data element or indicator from source data.

str:Concept.com:Name: IMF Data Overlap
str:Concept.com:Description: Indicates the potential for overlap within IMF data.

str:Concept.com:Name: Confidentiality Status
str:Concept.com:Description: This classification provides information about the sensitivity and confidentiality status of the data. (Source:SDMX)

str:Concept.com:Name: Reporting Period Type
str:Concept.com:Description: It is used to identify and distinguish between different types of time periods in economic and financial reporting. The specific start and end dates for a fiscal year (FY) can vary depending on the country, organization, or industry. When reporting data using this codelist, it is essential to specify the exact start and end dates of the fiscal year being referenced.

str:Concept.com:Name: Reference Period
str:Concept.com:Description: A time interval defined by a start date and an end date, used to constrain and specify the timeframe for reporting data.

str:Concept.com:Name: Base year
str:Concept.com:Description: The reference year used for comparison in the calculation of index numbers or other statistical measures. Changes in values over time are typically expressed as percentage deviations from the base year.

str:Concept.com:Name: Calendar year
str:Concept.com:Description: A period of twelve consecutive months starting on January 1st and ending on December 31st, as per the Gregorian calendar.

str:Concept.com:Name: Fiscal year
str:Concept.com:Description: A twelve-month period used by governments and businesses for accounting and financial reporting purposes. The start and end dates of a fiscal year can vary depending on the organization and country but often differ from the calendar year.

str:Concept.com:Name: Country
str:Concept.com:Description: The country or region for which the data or statistics in a resource are collected or reported.

str:Concept.com:Name: Counterpart Country
str:Concept.com:Description: The country or region with which a transaction or interaction occurs in the context of international statistics or data.

str:Concept.com:Name: Unit of Measure
str:Concept.com:Description: The standard unit used to quantify a particular data element or indicator.I It encompasses various units, including currency, physical units, percentages, and other standardized measures.

str:Concept.com:Name: Currency
str:Concept.com:Description: Denominated in Currency specifies the currency in which a financial instrument is valued and settled.

str:Concept.com:Name: Transformation
str:Concept.com:Description: Represents a set of codes identifying the specific transformations or calculations applied to source data to derive new data elements or indicators. A transformation involves a computation with one or more input values (either base variables obtained by observation or derived variables from prior transformations) that results in a single output value (the value of a new derived variable).

str:Concept.com:Name: Seasonal Adjustment
str:Concept.com:Description: Specific adjustment for the time series (e.g. seasonally adjusted).

str:Concept.com:Name: Gender
str:Concept.com:Description: Gender identity refers to each person’s internal and individual experience of gender. One's gender identity can be the same or different from their sex assigned at birth. (Source: UNECE 2023 Gender and salutation code lists)

str:Concept.com:Name: Sex
str:Concept.com:Description: An individual’s sex may be defined by one’s assigned sex at birth and/or one’s biological attributes which includes a combination of hormones, chromosomes, physiology, and anatomy. It includes both binary options as well as X and intersex. (Source: UNECE 2023 Gender and salutation code lists)

str:Concept.com:Name: Civil (or Marital) Status
str:Concept.com:Description: The legal status of an individual regarding marriage, such as single, married, widowed, or divorced.
